review:
Finally a hockey game on PC!  Really fun game with lots of control options and love the stylized retro charm.  While it may not be for everyone, or 100% fulfill the want for real hockey on PC... it's well worth the purchase price.

Good :
- No NHL, No problem.  BHL brings fun smash mouth 70's hockey with great atmosphere.
- While maybe not for everyone, I really love the retro feel and art style.
- Multiple control options... two button, multiple button, dual stick (a loose version of the recent EA NHL titles).
- It's a new hockey game on PC!

Not So Good :
- Story Mode is very punishing to start, expect to lose your first few matches to the AI.  This is heavily because only very basic controls (wrist shot, pass, check) are provided to start.  As you progress through the story you unlock more controls (slap shot, hip check, poke check, etc).
- Only once you finish the Story Mode, can you play a season/career with any team of your choice.  Wish decision was up front.
- Animations could use some work... some very awkward moments.
- Some controls could be tightened up, such as slap shots and body checks.

Bad :
- No Online MP at this time, local only.
- Advanced (dual stick) Controls locked behind Story Mode progression... can't even try them in Exhibition until you unlock it in Story Mode.

I'd give it a 7/10.  Really hope the dev continues with future updates to address of a few of my concerns.  Overall happy with my purchase, even at full launch price ($15 CAD).  Look forward to having some friends over for some local multiplayer.

review:
It's 5-on-5 arcade hockey, quick paced with short period lengths, big hits, and refs constantly looking the other way. It's good old arcade hockey gameplay wrapped up in a very unique 70s style. I love everything about the style with the small arenas, the soundtrack, the bluish ice, the sports cards you unlock, to just the art presented in the game in general.

The gameplay is a clunky, though. It all works, but it sadly isn't as responsive as you want it to be. There's noticeable delay you have to adjust to. It's not the hardest to learn, but it takes some time. The AI generally is fine, but I notice that they sometimes don't pursue the puck and it'll just sit there until you get it or your opponent wakes up from the nap your hit put him in. The goalies also never cover up the puck to stop play, they will always pass it away or behind/the side of the net. This is easy to predict, as well, so you can just keep regaining control of the puck pretty easily.

The only thing I dislike is that the advanced controls are locked for exhibition until reach a certain point in the story. Even in the story you only learn certain parts of the advanced controls and can't use other ones until you "learn" it later on. For example you can't do a slap shot until the game tells you that you can. Even if you looked up the controls and knew what to do, the game will not allow you to do it until you reach that point. It took about 3 hours or so for me to fully unlock the controls, that is way too long.

Overall, I find it quite fun and still do recommend it even with it's faults. I also will always support the effort to bring more sports gaming to PC.

review:
[b]A Lets Play of Old Time Hockey was featured on my youtube channel[/b]

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=893257699

and now onto the review

[h1]TL;DR Review[/h1]


Old Time Hockey is hockey game with a strong influence of NHL '94. It takes us back to the "good ol days" of Hockey where the rules were WAY more lax to say the least, and ruthlessness was encouraged as opposed to today's game.

-Gameplay-

Old Time Hockey has two game modes, Exhibition and Story Mode, unfortunately no online (as of now, I spoke with the devs and they told me if there was a ton of support for it, they would heavily look into it). Exhibition mode is a local multiplayer mode(for up to 4 players) with AI opponents included. We have 10 teams to choose all of which have very unique names, my personal favorite being the Long Island RumRunners. With a few different controller schemes, Classic. Two button mode. Beer mode (for one handed gameplay) and Advanced. Story Mode launches you into a failing franchise Hinto Brews, as you follow a classic from "last to champs" storyline. Afterwards you are rewarded with a "Career Mode" type of mode where you can play a full season with a team of your choosing.


-Graphics, Sound & Artstyle-

Old Time Hockey looks and sounds amazing. As soon as I started it up, I felt brought back to the days of my childhood as I blew on my SNES cartridge of NHL 94. The song "Old Time Hockey" along with the very retro soundtrack was just AMAZING to listen to.  


-Price-

The retail price is 11.99 USD 


-How many hours estimated?-

Honestly, I get lost in GREAT sports games like this. With inevitable DLC and hopefully WORKSHOP, I can see myself playing this game for HUNDREDS of hours.


-Buy it Now? Wait for Sale? Don't Buy?-

When I first a trailer to this game I was immediately sold, this was a much needed hockey game on Steam. One that delivered the retro mindless arcade feeling to it. I took a break from the NHL series and playing OTH made me feel so satisfied. There are some things I'd like to change about OTH, like the almost idiotic Defense AI, or the fact that you have to go through a vigorous tutorial on story mode, not having ADVANCED controls unlocked from the start. It has a heavy emphasis on hitting and sometimes it feels too easy to get some hits, but as told by Karthik, it's meant like that to give you the 70's Hockey feeling. The fights are a ton of fun too, although repetitive when doing line brawls but overall I've had tons of fun with the game. Will I recommend this game? HELL YES. [b]BUY IT NOW![/b].
